item.title: Reserve Tank Fuel Quantity Indicating Systems – Reserve Tanks Fueled

remarks.para: May be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 fueled provided:

numlitem.para: Tank is emptied and serviced with a known quantity of fuel, or measuring stick readings are taken to verify quantity in tank with inoperative indicator after refueling,
FMC is initialized with the known total fuel quantity,
Engine fuel flow indication and FMC Calculated fuel quantity are operative,
Remaining individual tank quantity indications are available,
For Combi, if ballast fuel is carried, stabilizer tank remains empty and CWT fuel in excess of ballast fuel may not be carried.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Total Fuel quantity indication may also be inoperative, if so:
Total fuel quantity must be calculated and manually initialized on the FMC PERF INIT page after engines have been started.
If it is necessary to jettison fuel:
Record the FUEL TO REMAIN quantity selected for the jettison operation.
Wait two minutes after fuel jettison is complete and then manually re-initialize the FMC with the total FUEL TO REMAIN quantity recorded above.
Center tank override/jettison pumps should remain OFF.
In case of en route failure of the FMC calculated total fuel quantity, flight crew must keep a fuel log for the remainder of the flight.

note.para: The PROGRESS page 1 display of Fuel quantity and actual time of arrival (ATA) at the last waypoint prior to failure may be used as a starting point. In some failure modes, PROGRESS page 2 FUEL USED data may be available.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "RES TANK #2 or #3 FUEL QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: RESERVE TANK FUEL QUANTITY INDICATING SYSTEMS

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Verify the fuel quantity in the tank associated with the inoperative quantity indication using one of the following methods:

numlitem.para: Defuel the associated tank (AMM 28-26-00/201) and service the tank with a known quantity of fuel (AMM 12-11-01/301).
Determine the fuel quantity using the associated tank’s measuring sticks (AMM 28-44-00/001).
